017package org.microbean.interceptor;
018
019import java.lang.invoke.LambdaMetafactory;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle;
021import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
022import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
023import java.lang.invoke.MethodType;
024import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
025
026import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
027import java.lang.reflect.Method;
028
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.Collections;
031import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Map;
034import java.util.Objects;
035import java.util.Optional;
036
037import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
038import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
039
040import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference;
041
042import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
043import java.util.function.BiFunction;
044import java.util.function.Consumer;
045import java.util.function.Function;
046import java.util.function.Supplier;
047
048import jakarta.interceptor.InvocationContext;
049
050import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
051
052import org.microbean.invoke.CachingSupplier;
053import org.microbean.invoke.FixedValueSupplier;

055/**
056 * A {@link Callable} {@link InvocationContext}.
057 *
058 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
059 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
060 */
061public final class Chain implements Callable<Object>, Cloneable, InvocationContext {
062
063  private static final Object[] EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Object[0];
064
065  private static final VarHandle CONTEXT_DATA;
066
067  private static final VarHandle PRIMED;
068
069  static {
070    final Lookup lookup = MethodHandles.lookup();
071    try {
072      CONTEXT_DATA = lookup.findVarHandle(Chain.class, "contextData", Map.class);
073      PRIMED = lookup.findVarHandle(Chain.class, "primed", boolean.class);
074    } catch (final NoSuchFieldException | IllegalAccessException reflectiveOperationException) {
075      throw (Error)new ExceptionInInitializerError(reflectiveOperationException.getMessage()).initCause(reflectiveOperationException);
076    }
077  }
078
079
080  /*
081   * Instance fields.
082   */
083
084
085  private final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions;
086
087  private final Map<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers;
088
089  private final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction;
090
091  private volatile Map<String, Object> contextData;
092
093  private final AtomicReference<Object> target;
094
095  private volatile Supplier<? extends Object[]> parameters;
096
097  private final CachingSupplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier;
098
099  private final CachingSupplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier;
100
101  private final CachingSupplier<?> timerSupplier;
102
103  private final boolean setTarget;
104
105  private volatile boolean primed;
106
107
108  /*
109   * Constructors.
110   */
111
112
113  /**
114   * Creates a new {@link Chain}.
115   */
116  public Chain() {
117    this(List.of(),
118         false, // sort
119         false, // copy
120         null, // interceptorSuppliers
121         null, // contextData
122         new AtomicReference<>(), // target
123         null, // parameters
124         null, // constructorSupplier,
125         null, // methodSupplier,
126         null, // timerSupplier
127         null, // terminalFunction
128         false, // setTarget
129         false); // primed
130  }
131
132  private Chain(final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions,
133                final boolean sort,
134                final boolean copy,
135                final IdentityHashMap<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers, // not copied!
136                final Map<String, Object> contextData,
137                final AtomicReference<Object> target,
138                final Supplier<? extends Object[]> parameters,
139                final Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier,
140                final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier,
141                final Supplier<?> timerSupplier,
142                final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
143                final boolean setTarget,
144                final boolean primed) {
145    super();
146    if (interceptorFunctions == null || interceptorFunctions.isEmpty()) {
147      this.interceptorFunctions = List.of();
148    } else if (sort) {
149      // copy is implied
150      final List<InterceptorFunction> unsortedInterceptorFunctions = new ArrayList<>(interceptorFunctions.size());
151      unsortedInterceptorFunctions.addAll(interceptorFunctions);
152      Collections.sort(unsortedInterceptorFunctions, Prioritized.Comparator.INSTANCE);
153      this.interceptorFunctions = Collections.unmodifiableList(unsortedInterceptorFunctions);
154    } else if (copy) {
155      this.interceptorFunctions = List.copyOf(interceptorFunctions);
156    } else {
157      this.interceptorFunctions = interceptorFunctions;
158    }
159    // Note to future maintainers: don't add isEmpty() check
160    this.interceptorSuppliers = interceptorSuppliers == null ? Map.of() : interceptorSuppliers;
161    this.contextData = contextData;
162    this.target = target == null ? new AtomicReference<>() : target;
163    this.parameters = parameters;
164    if (constructorSupplier == null) {
165      this.constructorSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(Chain::returnNull);
166    } else if (constructorSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<? extends Constructor<?>> cachingSupplier) {
167      this.constructorSupplier = cachingSupplier;
168    } else {
169      this.constructorSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(constructorSupplier);
170    }
171    if (methodSupplier == null) {
172      this.methodSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(Chain::returnNull);
173    } else if (methodSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<? extends Method> cachingSupplier) {
174      this.methodSupplier = cachingSupplier;
175    } else {
176      this.methodSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(methodSupplier);
177    }
178    if (timerSupplier == null) {
179      this.timerSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(Chain::returnNull);
180    } else if (timerSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<?> cachingSupplier) {
181      this.timerSupplier = cachingSupplier;
182    } else {
183      this.timerSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(timerSupplier);
184    }
185    if (terminalFunction == null) {
186      this.terminalFunction = NullTerminalFunction.INSTANCE;
187    } else {
188      this.terminalFunction = terminalFunction;
189    }
190    this.setTarget = setTarget;
191    this.primed = primed;
192  }
193
194
195  /*
196   * Instance methods.
197   */
198
199
200  /*
201   * Builder-like methods.
202   */
203
204
205  /**
206   * Returns a {@link Chain} whose internal list of {@link
207   * InterceptorFunction}s is sorted by {@linkplain
208   * Prioritized#priority() priority}, where the smallest number
209   * "wins".
210   *
211   * @return a {@link Chain}
212   *
213   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
214   *
215   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily
216   * deterministic, since two {@link InterceptorFunction}s with the
217   * same {@linkplain Prioritized#priority() priority} may sort to
218   * different indices in the relevant list.
219   *
220   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
221   * threads.
222   */
223  public final Chain sort() {
224    return this.interceptorFunctions.size() <= 1 ? this : this.copy(this.interceptorFunctions, true);
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Returns this {@link Chain} with its {@linkplain #getTarget()
229   * target} already set to the supplied {@code target}.
230   *
231   * @param target the new target; may be {@code null}
232   *
233   * @return this {@link Chain}
234   *
235   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
236   *
237   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
238   *
239   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
240   * threads.
241   *
242   * @see #getTarget()
243   */
244  public final Chain withTarget(final Object target) {
245    this.target.set(target);
246    return this;
247  }
248  
249  /**
250   * Calls {@link #setParameters(Object[])} with the supplied {@code
251   * parameters} and returns this {@link Chain}.
252   *
253   * @param parameters the parameters; may be {@code null}
254   *
255   * @return this {@link Chain}
256   *
257   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
258   *
259   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
260   *
261   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
262   * threads.
263   *
264   * @see #setParameters(Object[])
265   */
266  @Convenience
267  public final Chain withParameters(final Object... parameters) {
268    this.setParameters(parameters);
269    return this;
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Calls {@link #setParameters(Supplier)} with the supplied {@code
274   * parametersSupplier} and returns this {@link Chain}.
275   *
276   * @param parametersSupplier a {@link Supplier} supplying
277   * parameters; may be {@code null}
278   *
279   * @return this {@link Chain}
280   *
281   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
282   *
283   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
284   *
285   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
286   * threads.
287   *
288   * @see #setParameters(Supplier)
289   */
290  @Convenience
291  public final Chain withParameters(final Supplier<? extends Object[]> parametersSupplier) {
292    this.setParameters(parametersSupplier);
293    return this;
294  }
295
296  /**
297   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of an {@link
298   * InterceptorFunction} built from the supplied arguments.
299   *
300   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
301   *
302   * @param method a {@link Method} representing an interceptor
303   * method; must not be {@code null}
304   *
305   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the
306   * supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
307   *
308   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code lookup} or {@code
309   * method} is {@code null}
310   *
311   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
312   *
313   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
314   *
315   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
316   * threads.
317   *
318   * @see #plusInterceptorFunction(Lookup, Method, Supplier)
319   */
320  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final Method method) {
321    // Note to future maintainers: Don't get clever and pass
322    // this::getTarget instead of null as the trailing parameter.
323    return this.plusInterceptorFunction(lookup, method, null);
324  }
325
326  /**
327   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of an {@link
328   * InterceptorFunction} built from the supplied arguments.
329   *
330   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
331   *
332   * @param method a {@link Method} representing an interceptor
333   * method; must not be {@code null}
334   *
335   * @param interceptorSupplier a {@link Supplier} of an interceptor
336   * on which the supplied {@code method} will effectively be invoked;
337   * may be {@code null}
338   *
339   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the
340   * supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
341   *
342   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code lookup} or {@code
343   * method} is {@code null}
344   *
345   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
346   *
347   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
348   *
349   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
350   * threads.
351   *
352   * @see #interceptorFunction(Lookup, Method)
353   *
354   * @see #plusInterceptorFunction(InterceptorFunction, Supplier)
355   */
356  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final Method method, final Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier) {
357    return this.plusInterceptorFunction(interceptorFunction(lookup, method), interceptorSupplier);
358  }
359
360  /**
361   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the
362   * supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}.
363   *
364   * @param function the {@link InterceptorFunction}; may be {@code
365   * null} in which case this {@link Chain} will be returned
366   *
367   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the
368   * supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
369   *
370   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
371   *
372   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
373   *
374   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
375   * threads.
376   */
377  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final InterceptorFunction function) {
378    // Note to future maintainers: Don't get clever and pass
379    // this::getTarget instead of null as the trailing parameter.
380    return this.plusInterceptorFunction(function, null);
381  }
382
383  /**
384   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the
385   * supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}.
386   *
387   * @param function the {@link InterceptorFunction}; may be {@code
388   * null} in which case this {@link Chain} will be returned
389   *
390   * @param interceptorSupplier a {@link Supplier} of an interceptor;
391   * may be {@code null} in which case an appropriate representation
392   * of the {@link #getTarget()} method will be used instead
393   *
394   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the
395   * supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
396   *
397   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
398   *
399   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
400   *
401   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
402   * threads.
403   */
404  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final InterceptorFunction function, final Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier) {
405    if (function == null) {
406      return this;
407    }
408    final List<InterceptorFunction> unsortedInterceptorFunctions = new ArrayList<>(this.interceptorFunctions.size() + 1);
409    unsortedInterceptorFunctions.addAll(this.interceptorFunctions);
410    unsortedInterceptorFunctions.add(function);
411    final IdentityHashMap<InterceptorFunction, Supplier<?>> map = new IdentityHashMap<>(this.interceptorSuppliers);
412    final Supplier<?> thisGetTarget = this::getTarget;
413    if (interceptorSupplier == null || interceptorSupplier == thisGetTarget) {
414      map.put(function, thisGetTarget);
415    } else if (interceptorSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<?> cs) {
416      map.put(function, cs);
417    } else {
418      map.put(function, new CachingSupplier<>(interceptorSupplier));
419    }
420    return this.copy(unsortedInterceptorFunctions, false, map);
421  }
422
423  /**
424   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
425   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@link
426   * Constructor}.
427   *
428   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
429   *
430   * @param constructor a {@link Constructor}; must not be {@code
431   * null}
432   *
433   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
434   *
435   * @return a {@link Chain}
436   *
437   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
438   *
439   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
440   *
441   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
442   * threads.
443   *
444   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
445   *
446   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
447   *
448   * @see Lookup#unreflectConstructor(Constructor)
449   */
450  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup, final Constructor<?> constructor) {
451    constructor.trySetAccessible();
452    try {
453      final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor = terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.unreflectConstructor(constructor));
454      return
455        this.withTerminalFunction((ignoredTarget, parameters) -> terminalConstructor.apply(parameters),
456                                  true,
457                                  () -> constructor,
458                                  null,
459                                  null);
460    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
461      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
462    }
463  }
464
465  /**
466   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
467   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@link
468   * Method}.
469   *
470   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
471   *
472   * @param factoryMethod a {@link Method}; must not be {@code null}
473   *
474   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
475   *
476   * @return a {@link Chain}
477   *
478   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
479   *
480   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
481   *
482   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
483   * threads.
484   *
485   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
486   *
487   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
488   *
489   * @see Lookup#unreflect(Method)
490   */
491  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup, final Method factoryMethod) {
492    factoryMethod.trySetAccessible();
493    try {
494      final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor = terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.unreflect(factoryMethod));
495      return
496        this.withTerminalFunction((ignoredTarget, parameters) -> terminalConstructor.apply(parameters),
497                                  true,
498                                  null,
499                                  () -> factoryMethod,
500                                  null);
501    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
502      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
503    }
504  }
505
506  /**
507   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
508   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@link
509   * MethodHandle}.
510   *
511   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
512   *
513   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
514   *
515   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
516   *
517   * @return a {@link Chain}
518   *
519   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
520   *
521   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
522   *
523   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
524   * threads.
525   *
526   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
527   *
528   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
529   */
530  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup, final MethodHandle mh) {
531    try {
532      return
533        this.withTerminalConstructor(terminalConstructor(lookup, mh),
534                                     () -> MethodHandles.reflectAs(Constructor.class, mh));
535    } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
536      throw e;
537    } catch (final Exception e) {
538      if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
539        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
540      }
541      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
542    } catch (final Throwable e) {
543      throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
544    }
545  }
546
547  /**
548   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
549   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied constructing {@link
550   * Function}.
551   *
552   * @param constructor a constructing {@link Function}; must not be
553   * {@code null}
554   *
555   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code constructor} is {@code
556   * null}
557   *
558   * @return a {@link Chain}
559   *
560   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
561   *
562   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
563   *
564   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
565   * threads.
566   *
567   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
568   */
569  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Function<? super Object[], ?> constructor) {
570    return this.withTerminalConstructor(constructor, null);
571  }
572
573  /**
574   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
575   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied constructing {@link
576   * Function}.
577   *
578   * @param constructor a constructing {@link Function}; must not be
579   * {@code null}
580   *
581   * @param constructorSupplier a {@link Supplier} that will
582   * {@linkplain Supplier#get() supply} a {@link Constructor} when the
583   * {@link #getConstructor()} method is invoked; may be {@code null}
584   *
585   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code constructor} is {@code
586   * null}
587   *
588   * @return a {@link Chain}
589   *
590   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
591   *
592   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
593   *
594   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
595   * threads.
596   *
597   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
598   */
599  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Function<? super Object[], ?> constructor,
600                                             final Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier) {
601    return
602      this.withTerminalFunction((ignoredTarget, parameters) -> constructor.apply(parameters),
603                                true,
604                                constructorSupplier,
605                                null,
606                                null);
607  }
608
609  /**
610   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
611   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@link
612   * Method}.
613   *
614   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
615   *
616   * @param method the terminal {@link Method}; must not be {@code
617   * null}
618   *
619   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
620   *
621   * @return a {@link Chain}
622   *
623   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
624   *
625   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
626   *
627   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
628   * threads.
629   *
630   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
631   */
632  public final Chain withTerminalMethod(final Lookup lookup, final Method method) {
633    method.trySetAccessible();
634    try {
635      return
636        this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction(lookup, lookup.unreflect(method)),
637                                  false,
638                                  null,
639                                  () -> method,
640                                  null);
641    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
642      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
643    }
644  }
645
646  /**
647   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
648   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@link
649   * MethodHandle}.
650   *
651   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
652   *
653   * @param mh the terminal {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code
654   * null}
655   *
656   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
657   *
658   * @return a {@link Chain}
659   *
660   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
661   *
662   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
663   *
664   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
665   * threads.
666   *
667   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
668   */
669  public final Chain withTerminalMethod(final Lookup lookup, final MethodHandle mh) {
670    try {
671      return
672        this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction(lookup, mh),
673                                  false,
674                                  null,
675                                  () -> MethodHandles.reflectAs(Method.class, mh),
676                                  null);
677    } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
678      throw e;
679    } catch (final Exception e) {
680      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
681    } catch (final Throwable e) {
682      throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
683    }
684  }

686  /**
687   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
688   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@code
689   * terminalConsumer}.
690   *
691   * @param terminalConsumer the terminal {@link Consumer}; must not
692   * be {@code null}
693   *
694   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalConsumer} is
695   * {@code null}
696   *
697   * @return a {@link Chain}
698   *
699   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
700   *
701   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
702   *
703   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
704   * threads.
705   *
706   * @see #withTerminalConsumer(Consumer, Supplier)
707   */
708  public final Chain withTerminalConsumer(final Consumer<? super Object> terminalConsumer) {
709    return this.withTerminalConsumer(terminalConsumer, null);
710  }
711
712  /**
713   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
714   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@code
715   * terminalConsumer}.
716   *
717   * @param terminalConsumer the terminal {@link Consumer}; must not
718   * be {@code null}
719   *
720   * @param methodSupplier a {@link Supplier} that will {@linkplain
721   * Supplier#get() supply} a {@link Method} when the {@link
722   * #getMethod()} method is invoked; may be {@code null}
723   *
724   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalConsumer} is
725   * {@code null}
726   *
727   * @return a {@link Chain}
728   *
729   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
730   *
731   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
732   *
733   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
734   * threads.
735   *
736   * @see #getMethod()
737   */
738  public final Chain withTerminalConsumer(final Consumer<? super Object> terminalConsumer,
739                                          final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier) {
740    return
741      this.withTerminalFunction((target, ignoredParameters) -> {
742          terminalConsumer.accept(target);
743          return null;
744        },
745        false,
746        null,
747        methodSupplier,
748        this::getTimer);
749  }
750
751  /**
752   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
753   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@code
754   * terminalFunction}.
755   *
756   * @param selfContainedTerminalFunction the terminal function; must
757   * not be {@code null}
758   *
759   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code
760   * selfContainedTerminalFunction} is {@code null}
761   *
762   * @return a {@link Chain}
763   *
764   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
765   *
766   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
767   *
768   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
769   * threads.
770   *
771   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
772   */
773  private final Chain withTerminalFunction(final Function<? super Object[], ?> selfContainedTerminalFunction) {
774    return this.withTerminalFunction((ignoredTarget, parameters) -> selfContainedTerminalFunction.apply(parameters), null);
775  }
776
777  /**
778   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
779   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@code
780   * terminalFunction}.
781   *
782   * @param terminalFunction the terminal function; must not be {@code
783   * null}
784   *
785   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalFunction} is
786   * {@code null}
787   *
788   * @return a {@link Chain}
789   *
790   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
791   *
792   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
793   *
794   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
795   * threads.
796   *
797   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
798   */
799  public final Chain withTerminalFunction(final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction) {
800    return this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction, null);
801  }
802
803  /**
804   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
805   * #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied {@code
806   * terminalFunction}.
807   *
808   * @param terminalFunction the terminal function; must not be {@code
809   * null}
810   *
811   * @param methodSupplier a {@link Supplier} that will {@linkplain
812   * Supplier#get() supply} a {@link Method} when the {@link
813   * #getMethod()} method is invoked; may be {@code null}
814   *
815   * @return a {@link Chain}
816   *
817   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalFunction} is
818   * {@code null}
819   *
820   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
821   *
822   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
823   *
824   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
825   * threads.
826   *
827   * @see #getMethod()
828   */
829  public final Chain withTerminalFunction(final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
830                                          final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier) {
831    return
832      this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction,
833                                false,
834                                null,
835                                methodSupplier,
836                                this::getTimer);
837  }
838
839  private final Chain withTerminalFunction(final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
840                                           final boolean setTarget,
841                                           Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier,
842                                           Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier,
843                                           Supplier<?> timerSupplier) {
844    if (constructorSupplier == null) {
845      if (methodSupplier == null) {
846        constructorSupplier = this::getConstructor;
847        methodSupplier = this::getMethod;
848      }
849    } else if (methodSupplier != null || timerSupplier != null) {
850      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have both a constructor supplier and either a method supplier or a timer supplier");
851    }
852    return
853      this.copy(0,
854                constructorSupplier,
855                methodSupplier,
856                timerSupplier == null ? this::getTimer : timerSupplier,
857                terminalFunction,
858                setTarget);
859  }
860
861  /**
862   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} with the
863   * supplied {@code timerSupplier} backing its {@link #getTimer()}
864   * method.
865   *
866   * @param timerSupplier a {@link Supplier} whose {@link
867   * Supplier#get() get()} method will implement the {@link
868   * #getTimer()} method; may be {@code null}
869   *
870   * @return a {@link Chain}
871   *
872   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
873   *
874   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
875   *
876   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
877   * threads.
878   */
879  public final Chain withTimerSupplier(final Supplier<?> timerSupplier) {
880    return
881      this.copy(0,
882                null, // constructor supplier
883                this::getMethod,
884                timerSupplier == null ? this::getTimer : timerSupplier,
885                this.terminalFunction,
886                this.setTarget);
887  }
888
889
890
891  /*
892   * Non-"builder" instance methods.
893   */
894
895
896  /**
897   * Returns the size of this {@link Chain}.
898   *
899   * <p>A {@link Chain}'s size consists of the sum of the number of
900   * its interceptor functions, plus {@code 1} if it {@linkplain
901   * #isTerminated() is terminated}.</p>
902   *
903   * @return ths size of this {@link Chain}; never negative
904   *
905   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
906   *
907   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
908   * threads.
909   *
910   * @see #isTerminated()
911   */
912  public final int size() {
913    return this.interceptorFunctions.size() + (this.isTerminated() ? 1 : 0);
914  }
915
916  /**
917   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
918   * #isTerminated() is not terminated} and {@linkplain #intercepts()
919   * does not intercept}.
920   *
921   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} {@linkplain
922   * #isTerminated() is not terminated} and {@linkplain #intercepts()
923   * does not intercept}
924   *
925   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
926   *
927   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
928   * threads.
929   *
930   * @see #isTerminated()
931   *
932   * @see #intercepts()
933   */
934  public final boolean isEmpty() {
935    return !this.isTerminated() && !this.intercepts();
936  }
937
938  /**
939   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is terminated with a
940   * {@linkplain #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier) terminal
941   * function}.
942   *
943   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is terminated with a
944   * {@linkplain #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier) terminal
945   * function}
946   *
947   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
948   *
949   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
950   * threads.
951   *
952   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
953   */
954  public final boolean isTerminated() {
955    return this.terminalFunction != NullTerminalFunction.INSTANCE;
956  }
957
958  /**
959   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} has at least one
960   * {@link InterceptorFunction} and hence will actually perform an
961   * interception.
962   *
963   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} will perform an
964   * interception; {@code false} otherwise
965   *
966   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
967   *
968   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
969   * threads.
970   */
971  public final boolean intercepts() {
972    return !this.interceptorFunctions.isEmpty();
973  }
974
975  /**
976   * If a {@link Constructor} is available, returns it, or {@code
977   * null}.
978   *
979   * @return a {@link Constructor}, or {@code null}
980   *
981   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
982   *
983   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
984   *
985   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
986   * threads.
987   */
988  @Override // InvocationContext
989  public final Constructor<?> getConstructor() {
990    return this.constructorSupplier.get();
991  }
992
993  /**
994   * If a {@link Method} is available, returns it, or {@code
995   * null}.
996   *
997   * @return a {@link Method}, or {@code null}
998   *
999   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1000   *
1001   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1002   *
1003   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1004   * threads.
1005   */
1006  @Override // InvocationContext
1007  public final Method getMethod() {
1008    return this.methodSupplier.get();
1009  }
1010
1011  /**
1012   * If a timer is available, returns it, or {@code null}.
1013   *
1014   * @return a timer, or {@code null}
1015   *
1016   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1017   *
1018   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1019   *
1020   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1021   * threads.
1022   */
1023  @Override // InvocationContext
1024  public final Object getTimer() {
1025    return this.timerSupplier.get();
1026  }
1027
1028  /**
1029   * Returns a mutable {@link Map} of context data for the current
1030   * invocation or interception event.
1031   *
1032   * @return a mutable {@link Map} of context data for the current
1033   * invocation or interception event
1034   *
1035   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1036   *
1037   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily
1038   * deterministic.
1039   *
1040   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1041   * threads.
1042   *
1043   * @see InvocationContext#getContextData()
1044   */
1045  @Override // InvocationContext
1046  public final Map<String, Object> getContextData() {
1047    final Map<String, Object> map = this.contextData; // volatile read
1048    if (map == null && !CONTEXT_DATA.compareAndSet(this, null, new ConcurrentHashMap<>())) { // volatile write
1049      return this.contextData; // volatile read
1050    }
1051    return map;
1052  }
1053
1054  /**
1055   * Returns the parameters for this {@link Chain}.
1056   *
1057   * @return the parameters for this {@link Chain}
1058   *
1059   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1060   *
1061   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily
1062   * deterministic.
1063   *
1064   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1065   * threads.
1066   *
1067   * @see #setParameters(Object[])
1068   *
1069   * @see InvocationContext#getParameters()
1070   */
1071  @Override // InvocationContext
1072  public final Object[] getParameters() {
1073    final Supplier<? extends Object[]> supplier = this.parameters; // volatile read
1074    if (supplier == null) {
1075      return EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY;
1076    } else {
1077      Object[] returnValue = supplier.get();
1078      if (returnValue == null || returnValue.length <= 0) {
1079        returnValue = EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY;
1080      } else {
1081        returnValue = returnValue.clone();
1082      }
1083      return returnValue;
1084    }
1085  }
1086
1087  /**
1088   * Sets the parameters for this {@link Chain}.
1089   *
1090   * @param parameters the new parameters; may be {@code null} in
1091   * which case an empty {@link Object} array will be used instead
1092   *
1093   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1094   *
1095   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1096   * threads.
1097   *
1098   * @see #getParameters()
1099   */
1100  @Override // InvocationContext
1101  public final void setParameters(final Object[] parameters) {
1102    if (parameters == null || parameters.length == 0) {
1103      this.parameters = Chain::emptyObjectArray; // volatile write
1104    } else {
1105      final Object[] clonedParameters = parameters.clone();
1106      this.parameters = () -> clonedParameters; // volatile write
1107    }
1108  }
1109
1110  /**
1111   * Indirectly sets the {@linkplain #getParameters() parameters} of
1112   * this {@link Chain} by way of the supplied {@link Supplier}.
1113   *
1114   * @param parameters a {@link Supplier} of the new parameters; may
1115   * be {@code null}
1116   *
1117   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1118   *
1119   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1120   * threads.
1121   *
1122   * @see #setParameters(Object[])
1123   *
1124   * @see #getParameters()
1125   */
1126  public final void setParameters(final Supplier<? extends Object[]> parameters) {
1127    if (parameters == null) {
1128      this.parameters = Chain::emptyObjectArray; // volatile write
1129    } else {
1130      this.parameters = parameters; // volatile write
1131    }
1132  }
1133
1134  /**
1135   * Returns the target of the interception, if any.
1136   *
1137   * @return the target of the interception, or {@code null}
1138   *
1139   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1140   *
1141   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily
1142   * deterministic.
1143   *
1144   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1145   * threads.
1146   *
1147   * @see InvocationContext#getTarget()
1148   */
1149  @Override // InvocationContext
1150  public final Object getTarget() {
1151    return this.target.get();
1152  }
1153
1154  /**
1155   * Returns a copy of this {@link Chain}.
1156   *
1157   * @return a copy of this {@link Chain}
1158   *
1159   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1160   *
1161   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1162   *
1163   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1164   * threads.
1165   */
1166  @Override
1167  public final Chain clone() {
1168    return this.copy(0);
1169  }
1170
1171  private final Chain copy(final int index) {
1172    return this.copy(index,
1173                     this::getConstructor,
1174                     this::getMethod,
1175                     this::getTimer,
1176                     this.terminalFunction,
1177                     this.setTarget);
1178  }
1179
1180  private final Chain copy(final int index,
1181                           final Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier,
1182                           final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier,
1183                           final Supplier<?> timerSupplier,
1184                           final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
1185                           final boolean setTarget) {
1186    final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions;
1187    // Defensive copying of this map is deliberately not handled by
1188    // the constructor so we do it here.
1189    final IdentityHashMap<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers =
1190      new IdentityHashMap<>(this.interceptorSuppliers);
1191    final int functionCount = this.interceptorFunctions.size();
1192    if (index <= 0 || functionCount <= 0) {
1193      interceptorFunctions = this.interceptorFunctions;
1194    } else if (index >= functionCount) {
1195      interceptorFunctions = List.of();
1196    } else {
1197      interceptorFunctions = this.interceptorFunctions.subList(index, functionCount);
1198      for (int i = 0; i < index; i++) {
1199        interceptorSuppliers.remove(this.interceptorFunctions.get(i));
1200      }
1201    }
1202    return
1203      new Chain(interceptorFunctions,
1204                false, // sort
1205                false, // copy
1206                interceptorSuppliers,
1207                this.contextData,
1208                this.target,
1209                this.parameters,
1210                constructorSupplier == null ? this::getConstructor : constructorSupplier,
1211                methodSupplier == null ? this::getMethod : methodSupplier,
1212                timerSupplier == null ? this::getTimer : timerSupplier,
1213                terminalFunction,
1214                setTarget,
1215                this.isPrimed());
1216  }
1217
1218  private final Chain copy(final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions,
1219                           final boolean sort) {
1220    return this.copy(interceptorFunctions, sort, new IdentityHashMap<>(this.interceptorSuppliers));
1221  }
1222
1223  private final Chain copy(final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions,
1224                           final boolean sort,
1225                           final IdentityHashMap<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers) {
1226    final Chain returnValue =
1227      new Chain(interceptorFunctions,
1228                sort,
1229                false, // copy
1230                interceptorSuppliers,
1231                this.contextData,
1232                this.target,
1233                this.parameters,
1234                this::getConstructor,
1235                this::getMethod,
1236                this::getTimer,
1237                this.terminalFunction,
1238                this.setTarget,
1239                this.isPrimed());
1240    returnValue.parameters = this.parameters; // volatile read and write
1241    return returnValue;
1242  }
1243
1244  /**
1245   * <em>Primes</em> this {@link Chain} by calling {@link
1246   * Supplier#get()} on each of its interceptor suppliers, priming
1247   * them for subsequent use.
1248   *
1249   * <p>After an invocation of this method, the {@link #isPrimed()}
1250   * method will forever afterwards return {@code true}.</p>
1251   *
1252   * @return this {@link Chain}
1253   *
1254   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1255   *
1256   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1257   *
1258   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1259   * threads.
1260   *
1261   * @see #isPrimed()
1262   */
1263  public final Chain prime() {
1264    if (PRIMED.compareAndSet(this, false, true)) { // volatile semantics
1265      this.interceptorSuppliers.forEach(Chain::prime);
1266    }
1267    return this;
1268  }
1269
1270  /**
1271   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is primed.
1272   *
1273   * <p>A {@link Chain} is <em>primed</em> after the {@link #prime()}
1274   * method has been called successfully.</p>
1275   *
1276   * <p>Priming a {@link Chain} initializes its interceptor
1277   * suppliers.</p>
1278   *
1279   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is primed
1280   *
1281   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1282   *
1283   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1284   * threads.
1285   *
1286   * @see #prime()
1287   */
1288  public final boolean isPrimed() {
1289    return this.primed; // volatile read
1290  }
1291
1292  /**
1293   * Calls the {@link #proceed()} method and returns its result.
1294   *
1295   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #proceed()} method
1296   *
1297   * @exception Exception if an error occurs
1298   *
1299   * @see #proceed()
1300   */
1301  @Override
1302  public final Object call() throws Exception {
1303    return this.proceed();
1304  }
1305
1306  /**
1307   * Proceeds to the next interception in the {@link Chain} and
1308   * returns any result.
1309   *
1310   * @return any result of the interception
1311   *
1312   * @exception Exception if an error occurs
1313   *
1314   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1315   *
1316   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
1317   * determinism.
1318   *
1319   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1320   * threads.
1321   *
1322   * @see InvocationContext#proceed()
1323   */
1324  @Override
1325  public final Object proceed() throws Exception {
1326    final Object returnValue;
1327    if (this.interceptorFunctions.isEmpty()) {
1328      returnValue = this.terminalFunction.apply(this.getTarget(), this.getParameters());
1329      if (this.setTarget) {
1330        this.target.set(returnValue);
1331      }
1332    } else {
1333      final Chain chain = this.copy(1);
1334      assert this.getTarget() == chain.getTarget();
1335      final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction = this.interceptorFunctions.get(0);
1336      final Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier = this.interceptorSuppliers.get(interceptorFunction);
1337      if (interceptorSupplier == null) {
1338        returnValue = interceptorFunction.intercept(chain.getTarget(), chain);
1339      } else {
1340        returnValue = interceptorFunction.intercept(interceptorSupplier.get(), chain);
1341      }
1342    }
1343    return returnValue;
1344  }
1345
1346
1347  /*
1348   * Static methods.
1349   */
1350
1351
1352  /**
1353   * Calls {@link Supplier#get()} on the supplied {@link Supplier} to
1354   * "prime" it.
1355   *
1356   * @param ignored ignored; required to make this method look like a
1357   * {@link BiConsumer}
1358   *
1359   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} to prime; must not be {@code
1360   * null}
1361   *
1362   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
1363   * null}
1364   */
1365  private static final void prime(final Object ignored, final Supplier<?> supplier) {
1366    supplier.get();
1367  }
1368
1369  private static final Object[] emptyObjectArray() {
1370    return EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY;
1371  }
1372
1373  private static final <T> T returnNull() {
1374    return null;
1375  }
1376
1377  /**
1378   * Invokes {@link MethodHandles#reflectAs(Class, MethodHandle)} with
1379   * {@link Constructor Constructor.class} and the supplied {@link
1380   * MethodHandle} as arguments, and returns the result.
1381   *
1382   * @param mh the {@link MethodHandle} representing a constructor;
1383   * must not be {@code null}
1384   *
1385   * @return a {@link Constructor} representing the supplied {@link
1386   * MethodHandle}
1387   *
1388   * @exception ClassCastException if {@code mh} does not represent a
1389   * constructor
1390   *
1391   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code mh} is not a direct
1392   * method handle
1393   *
1394   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code mh} is {@code null}
1395   *
1396   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1397   *
1398   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1399   *
1400   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1401   * threads.
1402   */
1403  @Convenience
1404  public static final Constructor<?> constructor(final MethodHandle mh) {
1405    return MethodHandles.reflectAs(Constructor.class, mh);
1406  }
1407
1408  /**
1409   * Invokes {@link MethodHandles#reflectAs(Class, MethodHandle)} with
1410   * {@link Method Method.class} and the supplied {@link MethodHandle}
1411   * as arguments, and returns the result.
1412   *
1413   * @param mh the {@link MethodHandle} representing a method; must
1414   * not be {@code null}
1415   *
1416   * @return a {@link Method} representing the supplied {@link
1417   * MethodHandle}
1418   *
1419   * @exception ClassCastException if {@code mh} does not represent a
1420   * method
1421   *
1422   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code mh} is not a direct
1423   * method handle
1424   *
1425   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code mh} is {@code null}
1426   *
1427   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1428   *
1429   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1430   *
1431   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1432   * threads.
1433   */
1434  @Convenience
1435  public static final Method method(final MethodHandle mh) {
1436    return MethodHandles.reflectAs(Method.class, mh);
1437  }
1438
1439  /**
1440   * Returns an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method
1441   * designated by the supplied arguments.
1442   *
1443   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1444   *
1445   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the method; must not
1446   * be {@code null}
1447   *
1448   * @param methodName the name of the method; must not be {@code
1449   * null}
1450   *
1451   * @return an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method
1452   * designated by the supplied arguments
1453   *
1454   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1455   *
1456   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs while looking
1457   * up the relevant method
1458   *
1459   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1460   *
1461   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1462   *
1463   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1464   * threads.
1465   */
1466  public static final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup,
1467                                                              final Class<?> targetClass,
1468                                                              final String methodName) {
1469    try {
1470      return
1471        interceptorFunction(lookup,
1472                            lookup.findVirtual(targetClass,
1473                                               methodName,
1474                                               MethodType.methodType(Object.class,
1475                                                                     InvocationContext.class)));
1476    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1477      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1478    }
1479  }
1480
1481  /**
1482   * Returns an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method
1483   * designated by the supplied arguments.
1484   *
1485   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1486   *
1487   * @param method a {@link Method}; must not be {@code null}
1488   *
1489   * @return an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method
1490   * designated by the supplied arguments
1491   *
1492   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1493   *
1494   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs while
1495   * {@linkplain Lookup#unreflect(Method) unreflecting} the relevant
1496   * method
1497   *
1498   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1499   *
1500   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1501   *
1502   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1503   * threads.
1504   */
1505  public static final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final Method method) {
1506    try {
1507      return interceptorFunction(lookup, lookup.unreflect(method));
1508    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
1509      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1510    }
1511  }
1512
1513  /**
1514   * Returns an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method
1515   * designated by the supplied arguments.
1516   *
1517   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1518   *
1519   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be null}
1520   *
1521   * @return an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method
1522   * designated by the supplied arguments
1523   *
1524   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1525   *
1526   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs while looking
1527   * up the relevant method
1528   *
1529   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1530   *
1531   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1532   *
1533   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1534   * threads.
1535   */
1536  public static final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final MethodHandle mh) {
1537    final MethodType methodType = mh.type();
1538    final String methodName;
1539    final MethodType signature;
1540    final MethodType factoryType;
1541    final boolean invokeExact;
1542    if (void.class.equals(methodType.returnType())) {
1543      methodName = "execute";
1544      factoryType = MethodType.methodType(InterceptorProcedure.class);
1545      signature = MethodType.methodType(void.class, List.of(Object.class, InvocationContext.class));
1546    } else {
1547      methodName = "intercept";
1548      factoryType = MethodType.methodType(InterceptorFunction.class);
1549      signature = MethodType.methodType(Object.class, List.of(Object.class, InvocationContext.class));
1550    }
1551    try {
1552      final MethodHandle factory =
1553        LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1554                                      methodName,
1555                                      factoryType,
1556                                      signature,
1557                                      mh, // better conform to signature
1558                                      methodType) // signature enforced dynamically at runtime
1559        .getTarget();
1560      if (InterceptorFunction.class.equals(factoryType.returnType())) {
1561        return (InterceptorFunction)factory.invokeExact();
1562      } else {
1563        return (InterceptorProcedure)factory.invokeExact();
1564      }
1565    } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1566      throw e;
1567    } catch (final Exception e) {
1568      if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1569        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1570      }
1571      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1572    } catch (final Throwable e) {
1573      throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1574    }
1575  }
1576
1577  /**
1578   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link
1579   * #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)} method, built from
1580   * the supplied arguments.
1581   *
1582   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1583   *
1584   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the desired method;
1585   * must not be {@code null}
1586   *
1587   * @param methodName the name of the method to lookup; must not be
1588   * {@code null}
1589   *
1590   * @param methodType a {@link MethodType} representing the desired
1591   * method's signature and return type; must not be {@code null}
1592   *
1593   * @return a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link
1594   * #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)} method, built from
1595   * the supplied arguments
1596   *
1597   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1598   *
1599   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs
1600   *
1601   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1602   *
1603   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1604   *
1605   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1606   *
1607   * @see #terminalFunction(Lookup, MethodHandle)
1608   *
1609   * @see Lookup#findVirtual(Class, String, MethodType)
1610   */
1611  public static final BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> terminalFunction(final Lookup lookup,
1612                                                                            final Class<?> targetClass,
1613                                                                            final String methodName,
1614                                                                            final MethodType methodType) {
1615    try {
1616      return
1617        terminalFunction(lookup,
1618                         lookup.findVirtual(targetClass,
1619                                            methodName,
1620                                            methodType));
1621    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1622      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1623    }
1624  }
1625
1626  /**
1627   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link
1628   * #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)} method, built from
1629   * the supplied arguments.
1630   *
1631   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} {@linkplain
1632   * Lookup#privateLookupIn(Class, Lookup) in which to create a
1633   * private <code>Lookup</code>}; must not be {@code null}
1634   *
1635   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
1636   *
1637   * @return a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link
1638   * #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)} method, built from
1639   * the supplied arguments
1640   *
1641   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1642   *
1643   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs
1644   *
1645   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1646   *
1647   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1648   *
1649   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1650   *
1651   * @see #terminalFunction(Lookup, MethodHandle)
1652   */
1653  public static final BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> terminalFunction(final Class<?> targetClass, MethodHandle mh) {
1654    try {
1655      return terminalFunction(MethodHandles.privateLookupIn(targetClass, MethodHandles.lookup()), mh);
1656    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
1657      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1658    }
1659  }
1660
1661  /**
1662   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link
1663   * #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)} method, built from
1664   * the supplied arguments.
1665   *
1666   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1667   *
1668   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
1669   *
1670   * @return a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link
1671   * #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)} method, built from
1672   * the supplied arguments
1673   *
1674   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1675   *
1676   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs
1677   *
1678   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1679   *
1680   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1681   *
1682   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1683   */
1684  public static final BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> terminalFunction(final Lookup lookup, MethodHandle mh) {
1685    final MethodType methodType = mh.type();
1686    final int parameterCount = methodType.parameterCount();
1687    BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> returnValue = null;
1688    if (parameterCount <= 0) {
1689      throw new IllegalArgumentException("mh.methodType().parameterCount() <= 0: " + mh);
1690    } else if (parameterCount == 1) {
1691      // The sole parameter is assumed to be the receiver type, so the
1692      // virtual method the handle represents has no parameters.
1693      if (void.class.equals(methodType.returnType())) {
1694        // The virtual method the handle represents has no parameters
1695        // and returns nothing, so is like a Runnable.  We have to use
1696        // Consumer because of the sole receiver parameter.
1697        final MethodType consumerAcceptSignature = MethodType.methodType(void.class, List.of(Object.class));
1698        try {
1699          final Consumer<? super Object> consumer =
1700            (Consumer<? super Object>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1701                                                                    "accept",
1702                                                                    MethodType.methodType(Consumer.class),
1703                                                                    consumerAcceptSignature,
1704                                                                    mh,
1705                                                                    methodType)
1706            .getTarget()
1707            .invokeExact();
1708          returnValue = (target, parameters) -> {
1709            consumer.accept(target);
1710            return null;
1711          };
1712        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1713          throw e;
1714        } catch (final Exception e) {
1715          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1716            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1717          }
1718          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1719        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1720          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1721        }
1722      } else {
1723        // The virtual method the handle represents has no parameters
1724        // and returns something, so is like a Supplier<?>.  We have
1725        // to use Function<? super Object, ?> because of the receiver
1726        // parameter.
1727        final MethodType functionApplySignature = MethodType.methodType(Object.class, List.of(Object.class));
1728        try {
1729          final Function<? super Object, ?> function =
1730            (Function<? super Object, ?>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1731                                                                       "apply",
1732                                                                       MethodType.methodType(Function.class),
1733                                                                       functionApplySignature,
1734                                                                       mh,
1735                                                                       methodType)
1736            .getTarget()
1737            .invokeExact();
1738          returnValue = (target, parameters) -> function.apply(target);
1739        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1740          throw e;
1741        } catch (final Exception e) {
1742          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1743        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1744          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1745        }
1746      }
1747    } else if (parameterCount == 2 && Object[].class.equals(methodType.parameterType(1))) {
1748      // The virtual method the handle represents has one parameter of
1749      // type Object[].class.  The first of the two parameters is the
1750      // receiver type.
1751      if (void.class.equals(methodType.returnType())) {
1752        // The virtual method the handle represents takes one
1753        // parameter of type Object[].class and returns nothing, so is
1754        // like a Consumer<? super Object[]>.  We have to use
1755        // BiConsumer<? super Object, ? super Object[]> because of the
1756        // receiver parameter.
1757        try {
1758          final MethodType biConsumerAcceptSignature = MethodType.methodType(void.class, List.of(Object.class, Object.class));
1759          final BiConsumer<? super Object, ? super Object[]> biConsumer =
1760            (BiConsumer<? super Object, ? super Object[]>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1761                                                                                        "accept",
1762                                                                                        MethodType.methodType(BiConsumer.class), // returns BiConsumer and captures no variables
1763                                                                                        biConsumerAcceptSignature, // compiled/erased signature of BiConsumer::accept
1764                                                                                        mh, // better conform to signature
1765                                                                                        methodType) // signature enforced dynamically at runtime (same as compiled/erased in this case)
1766            .getTarget()
1767            .invokeExact();
1768          returnValue = (target, parameters) -> {
1769            biConsumer.accept(target, parameters);
1770            return null;
1771          };
1772        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1773          throw e;
1774        } catch (final Exception e) {
1775          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1776            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1777          }
1778          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1779        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1780          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1781        }
1782      } else {
1783        // The virtual method the handle represents takes one
1784        // parameter of type Object[].class and returns something, so
1785        // is like a Function<? super Object[], ?>.  We have to use
1786        // BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> because of
1787        // the receiver parameter.
1788        try {
1789          final MethodType biFunctionApplySignature = MethodType.methodType(Object.class, List.of(Object.class, Object.class));
1790          returnValue =
1791            (BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1792                                                                                "apply",
1793                                                                                MethodType.methodType(BiFunction.class), // returns BiFunction and captures no variables
1794                                                                                biFunctionApplySignature, // compiled/erased signature of BiFunction::apply
1795                                                                                mh, // better conform to signature
1796                                                                                methodType) // signature enforced dynamically at runtime
1797            .getTarget()
1798            .invokeExact();
1799        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1800          throw e;
1801        } catch (final Exception e) {
1802          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1803            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1804          }
1805          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1806        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1807          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1808        }
1809      }
1810    } else {
1811      final MethodHandle spreader = mh.asSpreader(Object[].class, parameterCount - 1);
1812      returnValue = (target, parameters) -> {
1813        try {
1814          return spreader.invoke(target, parameters);
1815        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1816          throw e;
1817        } catch (final Exception e) {
1818          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1819            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1820          }
1821          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1822        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1823          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1824        }
1825      };
1826    }
1827    return returnValue;
1828  }
1829
1830  /**
1831   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain
1832   * #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1833   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1834   *
1835   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1836   *
1837   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the constructor;
1838   * must not be {@code null}
1839   *
1840   * @param parameters the constructor's parameters; must not be
1841   * {@code null}
1842   *
1843   * @return a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain
1844   * #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1845   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1846   *
1847   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1848   *
1849   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the
1850   * constructor
1851   *
1852   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1853   *
1854   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1855   *
1856   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1857   * threads.
1858   *
1859   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, Class, MethodType)
1860   *
1861   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1862   */
1863  public static final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup,
1864                                                                     final Class<?> targetClass,
1865                                                                     final List<? extends Class<?>> parameters) {
1866    return
1867      terminalConstructor(lookup,
1868                          targetClass,
1869                          MethodType.methodType(void.class,
1870                                                parameters == null || parameters.isEmpty() ? List.of() : List.copyOf(parameters)));
1871  }

1873  /**
1874   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain
1875   * #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1876   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1877   *
1878   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1879   *
1880   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the constructor;
1881   * must not be {@code null}
1882   *
1883   * @param methodTypeWithVoidReturnType a {@link MethodType}
1884   * describing the constructor's parameters; must not be {@code null}
1885   *
1886   * @return a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain
1887   * #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1888   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1889   *
1890   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1891   *
1892   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the
1893   * constructor
1894   *
1895   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1896   *
1897   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1898   *
1899   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1900   * threads.
1901   *
1902   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, Constructor)
1903   *
1904   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1905   *
1906   * @see Lookup#findConstructor(Class, MethodType)
1907   */
1908  public static final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup,
1909                                                                     final Class<?> targetClass,
1910                                                                     final MethodType methodTypeWithVoidReturnType) {
1911    try {
1912      return
1913        terminalConstructor(lookup,
1914                            lookup.findConstructor(targetClass, methodTypeWithVoidReturnType));
1915    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1916      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1917    }
1918  }

1920  /**
1921   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain
1922   * #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1923   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1924   *
1925   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1926   *
1927   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the method;
1928   * must not be {@code null}
1929   *
1930   * @param factoryMethodName the name of a virtual method to look up
1931   * that will create an instance of the supplied {@code methodType}'s
1932   * {@linkplain MethodType#returnType() return type}; must not be
1933   * {@code null}
1934   *
1935   * @param methodType a {@link MethodType} describing the method;
1936   * must not be {@code null}

1939   * #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1940   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments

1945   * method

1948   *
1949   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1950   *
1951   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1952   * threads.
1953   *
1954   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
1955   *
1956   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, Method)
1957   *
1958   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1959   *
1960   * @see Lookup#findVirtual(Class, String, MethodType)
1961   */
1962  public static final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup,
1963                                                                     final Class<?> targetClass,
1964                                                                     final String factoryMethodName,
1965                                                                     final MethodType methodType) {
1966    try {
1967      return
1968        terminalConstructor(lookup,
1969                            lookup.findVirtual(targetClass, factoryMethodName, methodType));
1970    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1971      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1972    }
1973  }

2022   * Lookup#unreflect(Method) unreflect}; must not be {@code null}

2026   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments

2046      return terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.unreflect(method));
2047    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
2048      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
